title: How to end a novel - Quora

response.answer_text: Anne Lamott gave us the answer to this in her book Bird by Bird. In novel writing the answer is Word by Word. Or to be more general- idea by idea and scene by scene. A novel, like a play normally takes place in a series of scenes. Each has a beginning, middle and end and takes the story forward in a specific way. Characters reveal more of themselves, learn something, face some challenge, engage in some conflict or resolve something. Overall every scene takes us closer to the denouement of the story where conflict and challenge are ultimately faced and - normally - overcome. That gives us the sense of satisfaction we need as the novel comes to an end. So to finish your novel you simply need to write the next scene. And the next one. And the next one. Until it’s all done. But to write that scene you also need to know what the characters themselves do not yet know - what conflict or danger they face, how it’s going to develop and how overcome. And that depends partly on decisions you make about interventions in the story (plot) or how protagonists will react to situations (character). But it’s a fascinating journey both for your characters and yourself. Good luck.

… she watched the cold, steel blade fall to the floor. No sound touched her ears as the knife clattered to the cream tile floor. She watched her blood stain her dirty sneakers, and drip to the ground. She bit her lip and watched the crimson puddle grow larger. ‘I’m sorry,’ she repeated over and over, until there was no life left in her body. That is a dramatic way to finish, and it definatly won’t fit every situation, but it is a way to finish. Some more practial tips may be that there is an ebb and flow to a story. Depending on how you develop your stories will depend where there if a good time to end. Some people start with the end in mind, and they are just filling in the in between. Some people write with the characters in mind, and their story develops through the writing. Studying good stories, practicing writing and getting feedback all help to give you insight to when your story is in the right place to finish.

Hi, Ending your novel totally depends on the writer. It needs a lot of research on how other writers end their books and what those ends make you feel. I generally let my characters take the lead. For example, I want my heroine to end up with this guy. How? Depends on the story I write and my character’s choices. If you feel confused about how to end your novel, write down possible ends in short sentences. Check which one would make the readers gasp, or cry or be happy, whatever you choose, it should make sense to the story. Remember, not every story needs happy endings. One of my short stories ends in a sad way. My first novel ends on a cliffhanger where the readers have to decide what my protagonist must have done. Hope this answer helps! If not, I am open to discuss, please write a comment below or contact me on jheel.g@gmail.com

This depends on what you mean. Are you struggling to sit down and write the book or are you struggling with coming up with a good ending? If it’s the first one I have an article that can help here: How to sit down and write. If it’s the second one, coming up with an ending I would sit down and think about a few alternate endings that are possible for your book, then pick your favourite and work towards that. As in anything perseverance is key. I would recommend that you sit down and have a hard think about why you are writing the book. Remember what got you started in the first place and beginning working to achieve your goals!

If you approach book writing with the idea of writing and writing until it is done it can be overwhelming. The way to complete a novel is to take a strategic approach. Say you want to finish your 300 paper novel in 30 days. How to do it? Simply write 10 pages a day, every day, without excuses, and it will become a habit. Become discipline with your writing and it will pay off every time.

A lot of people think you have to tie up loose ends or create an elaborate fulfilling ending. For me I found the best way to end a book is like they did for the show The Sopranos. Just cut it where ever. Of course it should make sense but there is no need for every question to be answered.

Get to the end and stop. This is not facetious advice: once you believe you are done, you should stop and let the thing “cool off” until you have enough distance to examine the entire manuscript and begin revising, which is where the real work begins.

This depends entirely on your plot and the kind of novel you are writing. Some genres, like romance, have a formulaic structure with a set type of ending (Happily Ever After, or HEA, in this case). Others give you more room to experiment. Here’s a good article on typical plot structure: A Writer's Cheatsheet to Plot and Structure.

The start of novel, generally determines the end of novel. So when you start a novel you start with a situation, that should be culminated, good bad or ugly way. So just figure out what you want your reader to feel after reading the end.
